of Evansville political science professor. If Mike Pence is to encounter any bumps at all, they could come early, as he shifts his focus from federal to state issues, Robert Dion said. In some cases, it can be an awkward transition, to go from being a lawmaker to an executive, and to go from the federal level to the state level. There's going to be that transition that might have a few hiccups to it, he said. Jackie Walorski said she expected Mike Pence to abide by Mitch Daniels ' wishes. He and I are aligned virtually down the line on conservative and fiscal issues. I'm excited for any door Mike Pence walks through, she said. ''Obviously it'd be great for the state of Indiana.''
